%text Ordinarily, we work with functions that have the same definition over the entire domain.
But then, a function may be defined differently in different regions of it's domain. Such a function is said to be defined in pieces - or piece-wise defined.
One such function is $f(x) = \vert x\vert$ - which is defined differently for $x\geq 0$ and $x\lt 0$.
% \[ \qquad f(x) = \begin{cases} -x, x\lt 0 \\ x, x\geq 0 \end{cases} \]
